sentence.text: The most common genetic cause is L1CAM-related X-linked hydrocephalus and that explains only 5%-10% of all male cases.
This suggests that children with CCDC88C-related autosomal recessive hydrocephalus can have normal developmental outcomes under certain circumstances.

We recommend CCDC88C analysis in cases of severe non-syndromic congenital hydrocephalus, especially when aqueduct stenosis with or without a medial diverticulum is seen, in order to aid prognosis discussion
